_exec_summary.SummaryText: The facility is currently developing and implementing a PSM (Process Safety Management program). In the event of a release of ammonia,  the following procedures are to be followed. These procedures are posted on all bulletin boards and given to members of the plant emergency organization team. Each member has an alternate and is assigned a responsibility. They are posted and include plant evacuation and employee accountability, shutting down system utilities and site assessment, calling fire department and ammonia system vendor for assistance, reporting release to Minnesota duty officer and company authorities regional risk management department. The stationary source is the fluid dairy faciltiy at 1930 Wooddale Drive, Woodbury, Minnesota 55125. This facility uses Anhydrous Ammonia cas no 7664-41-7 for refrigeration through out the system. The chemical specific prevention steps for Anhydrous Ammonia is covered in the PSM program and will have a separate file attached. There has not been a release within the past five years. The plant has an emergency response spill plan to cover all spills and releases of all chemicals used at the facility. This plan has been revised as of 06/23/03 and is distributed to the following agencies, local Woodbury Fire Department station 260, the Woodbury Police Department, Ramsey Hospital St. Paul, Minnesota and the State Emergency Response Commission and the Washington Cty Metropolitan Council. The plans table of contents covers the following, Section 1  Introduction, includes plan purpose and plan distribution, Section 2 Order of telephone notification, engineering spill response team, resource cleanup and disposal, chemical company representatives, telephone notification requirements, roles and lines of authority and comunication with responders Section 3 Facility maps with emergency shutoffs, hazardous substances quantities and locations, intermediate surroundings/draninage/waterways, facility map and area map including evacuation ro

utes, safe shelters Section 4 Pre-emergency planning and prevention, local agency roles, preventive measures Section 5 Emergency Control, personal protection,first aid, warning signals,evacuation, emergency equipment, site security Section 6 Spills, Recognition, prevention Section 7 Identifies specific spills, acids, caustics, ammonia, chemicals, dairy products, underground  petroleums, Section 8 Site cleanup, containment,  and recovery Section 9 Written report requirements, spill log,emergency release follow-up report, spill report follow-up forms, hazardous materials incident report Section 10 Training, OSHA requirements Section 11 updating plan Section 12 Certification, signature page Section 13 MSDS, products and labeling. Planned changes to improve safety are as follows, completion of PSM program and continued employee training.
